ygData.messageBody:
I completely agree with you. I hate this type of play from people who, by simply
moving on, could make the game a lot better for everyone else.

There are some great ideas in this thread. I have a couple of thoughts on the
subject also:

First, there are currently no level restrictions in this game. Why? Nothing
ticks me off more than to see a low level character running around in full
banded with some awesome weapon ... it practically SCREAMS of twinking. On any
other game you play of this type there is usually a level restriction. Something
like, not being able to hold or use the weapon unless you are that level, or not
being able to save it when you log off or die. Please, please, please .... get
this into Everquest.

Second, how about some sort of flag for an ultra rare item. If you have one ...
you cannot have another (unless you lose/sell the first). It may not fix
everything, but if a small group is camping for objects ... they WILL eventually
have to leave to get rid of them because they wouldn't be able to hold more.
This would limit those people running around and grabbing 5 rare items during
one super farming session ... just to sell them off. It's not so much the
farming that would be helped, it would be the reduction of the lines at the camp
sites.

Just my two cents on the subject...

-Faderic


Tom Swift wrote:

> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>
> A solution to camping shouldn't be to complicated.
> A high level magic weapon spawning on a unique NPC cannot spawn if the item
> exists in the "spawn area" AND the item must be initiated by a quest.
> Unique NPCs should also spawn in a random location in the zone.
>
> Farming is the main problem....I think. I have no respect for farmers. If
> they won't take turns on rare spawn item I will kill-steal it. I am a
> dark-elf after all. I don't necessarily like doing this, but when a group
> has been farming a spot for days and refuses to share the spawns there isn't
> really any option. So when the creature spawns....my group attacks it. We
> try to get it first and then accuse them of kill-stealing...which is true
> depending on your perspective.
>
> I just think that farmers ruin the spirit of the game. I never camp a rare
> spawn item for more than an hour or 2 spawns whichever comes first. I
> respect those who camp a spot so they can have that awesome weapon they
> really want but can't afford....but I depise those who camp a spot so they
> can sell the items. It just isn't in the spirit of the game.
>
> Just my opinion. I know some of you won't approve of my method of dealing
> with farmers, and you are entitled to that.
